Cookie Policy & Preferences

Effective date: January 16, 2026

Last updated: January 16, 2026

This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, the types of cookies we use (i.e., the information we collect using cookies and how that information is used), and how you can manage your cookie settings on WhiteKnight Academy.

For more information about how we process personal data, please see our Privacy Policy. If you are a California resident (or where similar laws apply), you can also review: Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information.

1) What are cookies?

Cookies are small text files used to store small pieces of information. They are stored on your device when a website loads in your browser. These cookies help ensure that the website functions properly, enhance security, provide a better user experience, and analyse performance to identify what works and where improvements are needed.

2) How do we use cookies?

Like most online services, our website uses both first-party and third-party cookies for various purposes. First-party cookies are primarily necessary for the website to function properly and do not collect any personally identifiable data.

Third-party cookies (where permitted and based on your consent choices) may help us:

  • understand how the website performs and how you interact with it (analytics),
  • keep our services secure and prevent fraud,
  • deliver relevant advertisements and measure campaign performance,
  • enable remarketing/retargeting (marketing),
  • improve your overall user experience and the speed of future interactions with our website.

Our website and marketing stack may include tools such as Google Analytics / Google Tag Manager, Google Ads, Meta (Facebook/Instagram), TikTok, Bing/Microsoft Advertising, and other similar services, depending on our configuration and your consent choices. Payment processing is handled by providers such as Stripe and PayPal, which may set or read cookies for fraud prevention and secure checkout.

3) Types of cookies we use

3.1 Necessary (Strictly Necessary)

Necessary cookies are required to enable the basic features of this site, such as providing secure log-in, security, fraud prevention, and adjusting your consent preferences. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable data.

3.2 Functional

Functional cookies help run certain functionalities such as remembering preferences (e.g., language), improving your experience, and enabling optional site features. These cookies are used only where permitted and/or based on your choices.

3.3 Analytics

Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics such as the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc. Analytics cookies are used only where permitted and/or with your consent.

3.4 Advertisement / Marketing

Advertising cookies are used to deliver relevant ads, limit repetition, measure ad effectiveness, and support remarketing/retargeting. Marketing cookies are used only where permitted and/or with your consent.

4) Manage cookie preferences

You can modify your cookie settings anytime by using the cookie settings panel. This allows you to revisit the cookie consent banner and update your preferences or withdraw your consent.

If the button does not open the settings panel, please ensure that CookieYes is installed site-wide (via the CookieYes WordPress plugin or site header), and refresh the page. Some ad blockers may interfere with consent tools.

6) Advertising, remarketing, and “Do Not Sell or Share” (US/CA)

Where permitted and based on your consent choices, we may use cookies and similar technologies for advertising measurement and remarketing/retargeting (e.g., Google, Meta, TikTok, Bing).

If you are a California resident (or where similar laws apply), you may have the right to opt out of certain data sharing for advertising purposes. Please see: Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information.

7) Browser controls

Different browsers offer various methods to block and delete cookies used by websites. You can adjust your browser settings to block or delete cookies. Below are links to support documents on how to manage and delete cookies in major web browsers.

  • Chrome: Support article
  • Safari: Support article
  • Firefox: Support article
  • Internet Explorer: Support article

If you are using a different web browser, please refer to its official support documentation.

8) Contact

If you have questions about cookies or privacy, contact us at: contact@whiteknight.academy.
